reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at the Santa Rita and would definitely return again, preferably for a longer stay. Our visit was primarily because of the good birding in Madera Canyon but we also enjoy hiking. The Santa Rita is a perfect base for both of these - you can essentially bird and hike the entire canyon from the Lodge (and thus save the parking fee!).
reviews.title: Rustic But Awesome

likes.disliked: — Somewhat dated but that added to the charm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our accommodation was in one of the casitas - these are older buildings and the floors are a little out of level, the bathroom dated and the shower head low, and the kitchen/cooking facilities limited to a two burner hotplate. However, everything was very clean and the beds were comfortable. If you don't feel like doing the dishes, paper plates and plastic cutlery are provided in addition to "real" plates and cutlery. The windows look out onto the creek that runs through the canyon and the lodge's feeders were nearby. At $85/night the Santa Rita was excellent value.

reviews.text: Your hiking options are numerous and the Lodge can give good advice about where to go. We hiked to the portal parking lot and back and also did the Nature Trail loop (definitely recommended).
